Start: ^Once the dinner has wound down, I quietly head to my room to rest.
PrimarySuccess: ^I sit down on my bed and put my head in my hands.
^I inhale and exhale deeply, clearing all the buzzing thoughts from my mind.
^It feels good to take a moment to unwind.
^I don't feel any different, but somehow... I know I am.

b: ^so many times I've lost count. Was it five?

PrimarySuccess: ^My head is filled with questions I will never find the answer to.
^Perhaps those are simply the weeks I remember. How many countless paths have I walked?
^Has this ever happened to anyone else?
^Were all those past weeks just one long nightmare? If so, how do I know I'm not still dreaming?
^But none of those questions can distract me from one pleasant truth:
^After what feels like an eternity, I finally feel good going to bed today.
^For the first time in a long time I don't dread what tomorrow brings...
^Whether that be another week at Sunflower House... or my first week leaving it behind.

b: ^The sound of the door creaking open pulls me from my thoughts.
^Timothy walks in and plops down on his bed.
^[Timothy] "I can't believe you're leaving. I-I'm gonna miss you, you know."
^] "That's nice of you to say. I'll miss you, too, man."
^Or I will when I actually do leave this place.
^I look at my empty suitcase. It gets harder and harder to convince myself to bother packing it.
^[Timothy] "Oh! Y-you're not packed yet! Can... can I help?"
^] "Sure. I don't have that much, though."
^I point out a few things to Timothy and start rummaging through my dresser.
^Divided between the two of us, the already simple task is completed in mere minutes.
^] "Jeez, you don't have to say it like that."
^[Timothy] "<jitter>Oh no! I-I didn't mean... I'm sorry!</jitter>"
^] "No apology needed. You're right... it really isn't a lot."
^"I guess I just never cared about getting new stuff."
^[Timothy] "Well, on the bright side: less to pack!"
^. I'm really feeling tired. I meant to be asleep by now."
^] "I should be in bed, too. You can have the bathroom first."
^Timothy nods and slips into the bathroom. The two of us conduct our nightly routine in silence.
^I lay myself down onto my mattress and look over at Timothy, who is already fast asleep.
^Even if I have to do this all again, at least I got to see him happy.
^I look over at Timothy's vacant bed.
^I feel a little bad that I couldn't help him.
^But that wasn't really what this was about anyway, was it?
^And if the week keeps on repeating, who's to say it even matters?
^Still... the thought of Timothy being carted off to Blackwell weighs heavily on me.
^I try to distract myself by packing my bags.
^It's probably futile, but I think I'm long overdue for a little optimism.
^When I've finished packing, I ready myself for bed and plop down onto my mattress.

PrimarySuccess: ^As I drift off, I reflect on the choices that led me to this moment.
^I could have done so many things differently...
^I slip into a deep and dreamless slumber.
^I sleep more calmly than I've slept in a long, long time.
SecondarySuccess: ^ as I go about my nightly routine.
^Timothy's sound asleep in the other bed, sporting a wicked new hair color.

s0: ^Now this nightmare will end and life can go on.
^All I've gotta do is wait 'til tomorrow.
s1: ^I need to do more than fix things for Timothy. I have to fix them for myself.

b: ^It's a little weird to even imagine tomorrow coming at all.
^How strange is it that I've gotten used to this weird repeat stuff?
^I look down at my barely-packed bags. I hadn't put much effort in since I didn't think it would matter, but now...
^I should probably be getting ready for tomorrow.
^I pack the rest of my things and slide into bed.
^Even though things worked out, I can't help but feel like something is wrong.
^Maybe the loop will break. Maybe all of this will end.
^But I can't shake the feeling that... this isn't over.
^That I still have more to learn.
^Whatever the case, I'll deal with it when it comes. For now, I'm too tired to worry.

SecondarySuccess: ^I wrap myself up in the blankets and fall gently to sleep.
FirstRRR: ^Well, I suppose it’s not going to be my room anymore. Not after today.
^I guess it's not going to be Timothy's room either.
^I look at my bags, half packed with the crap I call my own. Despite all my time here, it's still not much more than I arrived with.
^With a heavy sigh, I look away and toss myself into my sheets. @One of the last things I can call my own in this space.
^I'm alone in a room meant for no one, and nothing is fine.
^I'm leaving tomorrow and I don't know what to do.
^I start shaking slightly, as tears bubble in my eyes.
^I'm leaving tomorrow and I don't know what to do.
^I don't want to leave. I've been here too long. I don't know what I'll do when I'm gone.
^But I don't want to stay here, in this vacant room. I don't want to waste away.
^I don't want to leave. @I don't want to stay.
^As I drift off to sleep, all I can think about is how badly I want this pain to go away.
SecondRRR: ^I begin my nightly ritual. Despite feeling exhausted, I can't stop myself from thinking...
^The Deja Vu this week has been incredible. It's like... I know I've seen all this before.
^Showing Timothy around. Talking to people. Saying goodbye.
^And... poor Timothy. Gone. Just like I remember...
^I lie down in my bed and stare up at the ceiling.
^It still seems ridiculous to even think, but...
^Could it be that I'm stuck in some kind of... time loop?
^Maybe I'm just losing the last of my marbles. There's only one way to be sure.
^My memory is hazy, but I swear I remember everything until tonight as if it has happened twice.
^So... it all comes down to tonight.
^Will I wake up tomorrow and leave this place? Or will I wake to Timothy's first day.
^These thoughts eat away at my mind. I toss and turn for a while before sleep finally comes.
RepeatRRR: ^I sluggishly prepare for bed, feeling defeated.
^I slide under the covers, take a deep breath, and exhale.

b: ^But I learned new things. I am more than I was.

RepeatRRR: ^This week keeps on repeating. I don't understand why or how, but I've been given a chance to fix this.

b: ^Timothy has to be the key. If I can just help him...
^Not just to help Timothy, but to help myself. Adn when I do...

TheDream: ^`A Garden for the Mind` according to the brochure
^Pretty cheesy, but they said I don't really stand much chance in the real world.

s1: ^At least in here there are fewer people for me to disappoint
s2: ^But this was my choice, not theirs

s1: ^ I wonder if I'll ever see home again.

TheDream: ^I feel something gnawing at the back of my mind
^. I walk up to the building and heave open the large oak doors.
^The gnawing intensifies as I step inside. It's like an

s0: ^Wait, Max? How do I know that name?
s1: ^I don't question how I know their name. I just do.

TheDream: ^[Max?] "Hi! Welcome to Sunflower House! Are you the new resident I'm supposed to be expecting?
^[Max?] "Rad. Name's Max, pronouns are They/Them. Don't worry if you mess it up, I don't bite."

s0: ^to try and contain the writhing within
s1: ^in a vain attempt to dull the agony

TheDream: ^[Max] "Since your room's here on the first floor, I'll be... your... R.A.
^I nod. I'd rather not make a scene.
^[Max] "Why I don't I go ahead and show you to your room?"
^As Max leads me down the hallway and opens the door to my new room, I feel an overwhelming sense of
^[Max] "Your quarters, your Majesty. Uh, maybe you should lie down or something."
^[Max] "Okay, then. I've gotta get back to cleaning the cafeteria, so just come and find me whenever you're ready."
^Max departs, leaving me alone in my new room.

s0: ^Why doesn't it feel like the first time I've been in here?

TheDream: ^I look over at the other bed and

s1: ^a wave of despair washes over me
^I feel week. I lean against the wall

TheDream: ^The gnawing in my mind transforms into
^ as color drains from the world.
^The room falls away into darkness and I am whisked back to Blackwell.
^I can feel the whispers before I hear them. I'm not running this time.

Accusation1: ^[Voices] "This is your doing. You weren't there for him."

c: ^] "I tried to be friendly! I'm not responsible for what happened!"
^[Voices] "Idiot! Your selfishness has not even benefited you. Now you have nothing."
^] "It's not my fault! I barely knew him!"
^[Voices] "You're as worthless a liar as you are a person."
^[Voices] "This is why you'll never have any real friends."

g-0: ^The Voices laugh and howl. The walls of Blackwell pulse unnaturally, faster and faster as my heartbeat quickens.
^I try to shout again, but I can't form the words.
^I collapse, clutching my pounding chest as an icy wind whips across my face.
^The cackling Voices fade into a low rumble that begins toppling the walls around me.

Accusation2: ^[Voices] "You had a second chance and you still screwed it up. You're truly worthless."

c: ^] "I don't believe any of this. This is all wrong!"
^[Voices] "Idiot! You lie to yourself. Those are the worst lies of all."

g-0: ^I didn't understand what was happening, but that's no excuse.
^I grit my teeth and remember my therapy.
^] "I might have failed. And I might fail again."
^[Voices] "Such naive optimism. You fail because you're a failure. That will never change."
^] "You won't stop me. I'm done listening to you."
^The Voices rage and scream. The walls of Blackwell pulse unnaturally, faster and faster as my heartbeat quickens.
^I clench my fists as an icy wind tears at my skin.
^The screaming pitch grows higher and louder until it shatters the floor beneath me and I spiral into darkness.

b: ^] "I-I don't understand! I saved him! Why is this happening?!"
^"This was never about him, you piece of trash."
^, even a moron like you has to realize eventually."
^Oh god. Of course. It makes sense now.
^"I'm not ready to leave. That's... that's why."
^"I never needed to save him. I needed his help to save myself."
^[Voices] "Congratulations. You've realized the futility of all this."
^"You will never be ready. How could you ever be?"
^] "You're wrong. I know what I have to do now."
^"And I'm not afraid of failing any more."
^ I hold my tongue. Nothing good will come of feeding the Voices.

s1: ^The world doesn't want you. It's better to know that than to subect everyone to your worthlessness

Accusation3: ^Don't listen to them. I can do this. I just need another chance.
^The Voices continue to berate me, but grow softer and softer until I can't hear them over the chill wind blowing through my hair.
^I wander the silent maze of hallways for what feels like hours.
^Ribbons of sunlight begin peeking through the cracks in the ceiling above me.
^A warm mist fills the corridors and I lose myself in the haze.
